intro: Siphisia platanifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf siphisia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that resemble the leaves of the plane tree. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Siphisia platanifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
